posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
Hi CD!

I‚Äôm having this weird issue where when I press buttons 2 or 7 on the joystick, the robot gives a startcompetition() error and automatically disables. The code is here:

https://github.com/FRC-2815/Infinite-Recharge-2021_4.0

this issue started around when we tried to add the limelight code to the project. If anyone has some time i could really use a fresh set of eyes.

Thanks so much! 2815

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
Hello, I am getting a 404 error with the link. Is the code public?

For us, these sort of errors are almost always due to a bad variable. It is either an improper assignment, or using a variable that is not instantiated.

A quick question. Are you using a joystick that has that button? You can check that by clicking the USB tab in the driver station.

posts.name: James
posts.cooked:
I think you need to fix your link. 404s currently. This works:

Contribute to FRC-2815/Infinite-Recharge-2021 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Do you get any error messages in the driver station / Rio log when you‚Äôre connected to the robot?

You may be running into a runtime exception that‚Äôs causing the code to fail executing, resulting in it restarting on the Rio (which would look like you lose comms/robot code momentarily in the driver station, then everything comes back up ok and ready to go w/ robot disabled)

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: It was a private repo sorry. In sure its the right joystick because we have another revision of the code without a limelight that works fine. No there aren‚Äôt any other errors

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked: In both your Shooter and DriveTrain subsystems, you declare Limelight limelight but you never initialize it. Thus when you call on() and aim() respectively, you are trying to access the methods getDistanceToTarget() and getX() for a null object (the limelight variable).

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
You may find this article helpful in learning how to find and fix these types of problems in the future.

An unexpected error has occurred. When your robot code hits an unexpected error, you will see this message show up in some console output (Driver Station or RioLog). You‚Äôll probably also notice you...
